content.description:
A mixed line up a less than pretty face. Sturdier than it looks, this route tackles a thin seam up some shockingly solid stone.

Start climbing over sharp, forgiving edges to gain a  rest at a ledge. Clip a bolt and tackle the crux, which climbs broken cracks and small, varied edges. Find a stance and clip another bolt. Finish up a shield at a two-bolt anchor.

and like the route, this song takes a few minutes to get to the business (1:56):

youtube.com/watch?v=sPm-1YMâ€¦
content.protection:
Two bolts, varied gear, and a two-bolt anchor. A single rack up to a #3 camalot and small to medium

nuts.
content.location: This is the last route on the right marked by a thin, vertical crack.

climbs.name: The Greater Wrong Of The Right

content.description:
An exciting climb with a brilliant finish. A personal favorite, and a face climber's nightmare, this route is a thrilling campaign and guaranteed to cause some trouble. Smart, brainy climbing with a sustained finish. Every bit the grade, this multi-cruxed, well-protected route is a must do; a clean ascent will be truly earned. You Must Believe!

Begin up tense, technical terrain passing two bolts, gain a ledge with a great no hands rest, then follow three more bolts past the crux to a chain anchor.
content.location:
The 4th route from the left, this line almost shares the start with

Centre Bullet

.

content.description:
Thin, steep, touchy climbing that rarely lets up. Difficult and thoughtful moves mark the first two bolts, while intermediate, careful climbing finishes the rest. Vertical edge pulling up a sustained face,

Feels Like The First Time

is a continuous line with long moves and tricky feet. Expect to do a little wandering, this route is full value for the grade. Multiple sequences which are hard to read; expect a pump!
content.protection: Six bolts to a chain anchor.
content.location:
This is the first line on the left with a high first bolt. This is just right of

The Penguin.

content.description:
Really fun, this is the most forgiving line on the wall. The warm-up of choice at the area, this thin, well spaced route climbs up a sporadically featured face using sharp, crisp edges. The occasional rest can be found and will be welcomed.  Thoughtful climbing and dynamic moves, save some juice for the upper crux. For the full value, finish directly up the face to a ledge with a chain anchor.

Tricky, passable terrain with great, fluid movement. Think outside the box and you'll do fine.
content.protection: Six bolts to a two-bolt anchor.
content.location: This is the second bolted route from the left.

content.description:
An excellent voyage up a deceptive face. Start the route using sharp, positive edges and tricky, techincal climbing. Continue up the thin face to a good rest at the half-way point. Get your bearings and finish the route climbing through the crux near the last two bolts. Lean left off an awkward crack and stay strong. Choose wisely or prepare to log some air time.

Continuous climbing with incredible moves! This route allows just enough features to get you to the top. A great, tricky line, this is most likely the best route on the wall.
content.protection: Six bolts get you to a two bolt, chain anchor.
content.location: This is the third bolted route from the left.
